009package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
010
011import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
012
013/**
014 * A binary tree for detection. At each node of the tree, a test (feature) is
015 * done on the window. Depending on the result, either the left or right child
016 * of the node is selected and so on. When the process reaches a leaf, the
017 * corresponding value is returned.
018 */
019public class FeatureTree {
020        
021        //private final List<FeatureNode> nodes;
022        private final FeatureNode[] nodes;
023
024        protected FeatureTree(FeatureNode[] nodes) {
025                this.nodes = nodes;
026        }
027        
028        public FeatureNode[] getFeatures() {
029                return nodes;
030        }
031        
032        // evaluate the feature tree
033        protected double eval(IntegralImage II, int u, int v, double scale) {
034                FeatureNode feature = nodes[0]; // start at root of this tree
035                while (true) {
036                        // evaluate the current feature node to decide where to proceed:
037                        int dir = feature.eval(II, u, v, scale);
038                        // if the current node has a value for 'dir', return it:
039                        if (feature.hasValue(dir)) {
040                                return feature.getValue(dir);
041                        }
042                        // otherwise continue with the child node for 'dir'
043                        else {
044                                feature = nodes[feature.getChild(dir)];
045                        }
046                }
047        }
048
049
050        public void print() {
051                int featureCnt = 0;
052                for (FeatureNode node : nodes) {
053                        node.print(featureCnt);
054                        featureCnt++;
055                }
056        }
057
058}
